website_summaries.verdict: The new Roku 2 media hub offers loads of streaming services and fast performance, but it leaves out one of the cooler features of the previous version.
pros: Lots of streaming services and apps
cons: Remote no longer has a headphone jack

customer_reviews.title: The Roku streamer puts Virgin, Sky and others to shame - this is how all tv interfaces should be built
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the best entertainment devices I have ever brought. My family and I use it every day - watching Netflix, Amazon, iPlayer and more - its really fluid and easy interface coupled with the main bonus for me - it is incredibly fast, unlike our Virgin Media Tivo box which frankly is a disgrace for how much it costs. Virgin should take some very important lessons from Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Black

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to register on Roku GB website!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Roku box will guide you through set up, dead easy. I chose to use a wired connection to my internet but wireless is possible. Had issue after registering account in advance then inputting code into US website by mistake but after I emailed customer services they got me to de- activate account then re-register on Roku GB website. Good selection of catch up channels plus NowTV, Amazon Video and Netflix as well as other less well known video services. Lots of free streaming channels of old TV and films plus stuff for more niche audiences.
customer_reviews.author: Suffolk n' stripy

customer_reviews.title: Good with a few faults.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: works as expected, user interface is fast, nice selection of apps. Cons: doesn't support bluetooth speakers, insists on signing up and adding payment method during setup. I thought it supported Apple Airplay but it doesn't. Powers up and down using the HDMI cable, so ideal only when used with a TV and the TV remote. I use it with an old 27" Dell 1080p monitor and while the setup works, I have to manually power off the monitor for the box to power down and without bluetooth, I have to use the volume control on the speakers which are connected to the audio out on the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Great support and compatibility, poor Wifi
customer_reviews.text: This Roku 3 HD is an excellent media streamer. It plays content flawlessly over the net with one caveat, via ethernet. I tried to use this device via Wifi and although it was fast enough to stream the media it was constantly loosing it's connection. This was connected to my Virgin Hub and everything else in the house worked perfectly. In the end I used some home plugs and on ethernet the device is superb. The picture quality is brilliant and the codec support is spot on for such a small specialised device. On the whole I am very happy with it but if you are reliant on Wifi operation beware.
customer_reviews.author: P. Seagrave

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Having struggled watching catchup on my laptop I purchased this streaming stick on a whim, having compared the streaming sticks on the market at the time, and I am so glad that I did. It is simple to set up and use and has proved very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Stellington

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to stream NOW TV, Netflix, Amazon and other channels like BBC iplayer etc from a TV in the living room and one upstairs. All stream fine. Mainly bought as Amazon fire stick will not stream NOW TV or at least it didnt use to but this will. Great piece of kit, once you are streaming, but the menus and load time are slow especially on Netflix. Have bought two of these and can control both from the phone app which is great. Found the remote not that great on one but the other one works fine so just a faulty batch i guess.
customer_reviews.author: Missy L

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant little box that together with the usual free catch ...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant little box that together with the usual free catch up apps like iplayer etc also has Netflix, Amazon Prime and Now TV Had this for some time now and it's fantastic, but..... the remote control is absolutely awful really seems to struggle to send signal which is soooooo frustrating! Have downloaded the free Roku remote app on my phone to use as a wireless controller and it's perfect. If you're planning on only using the remote that comes with the unit buy the Roku 3 which has wireless connection not this almost useless IR remote control
customer_reviews.author: Prepared Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my family's needs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device. Unfortunately the Irish App Store does not include NowTV currently, but hopefully will soon. The device is small and unobtrusive, with a convenient remote with dedicated buttons for Netflix and YouTube. Lots of nice touches in how it animates Netflix previews, for example. Loads of free and paid content. Acts as a device you can cast to as well, and an iPhone app offers simple control. Can also play movies/songs off USB drives. The only lack as I recall is a digital sound out, but I get past this by using one from my TV to my surround sound - not ideal, but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Dermot H

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've had a HD smart TV for a few years but it's very laggy and Netflix picture quality wasn't all that. So I thought I'd try this after reading several reviews and hoping it would save me buying a new TV. I wasn't disappointed.much much faster response from the remote and apps open much quicker. Picture quality is also much better. Screen mirroring works very well from my galaxy s8,if only I could get Kodi to work !!
customer_reviews.author: driffty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy and useful product! I've used it almost everyday and it's made streaming from all my accounts so easy. I no longer need to hook up my laptop or phone I can just use this little device and it takes no time at all. I've taken it with me when I've gone away and it saves having to log in all you need is wifi and HDMI port tv and it's good to go! I wanted a device that offerd all the main steaming apps, I was mostly interested in Netflix, Amazon prime and Now TV plus Iplayer which this great little device has all of!
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Great if it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I used to run Emby sideloaded onto a NowTV box (Roku OEM). After Sky (spit) disabled this I bought the Roku 2. The NowTV was much more stable. Every couple of days I have to re-boot the Roku 2, if I dont, it wont play any movie. It would be great if it worked as it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Computeriser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is ace, can watch all our subscription tv on one box. We used this to replace the now tv box and xbox and smart tv service. Doesn't buffer like the now tv version did. Very impressed and we don't have to watch through the xbox anymore also less remotes
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Total disaster!! Unable to get it set up. Returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I tried multiple to get this product set up on my TV and failed every time. I finally, after about 30 attempts over two days, gave up and sent it back to Amazon. The two pieces kept losing sync and had to be re-paired. I don't want to count the number of times I had to enter my wifi password. Every time it failed I had to restart at the beginning of the whole process. I don't know if the item we were sent was defective but if it was typical of this product then I would not recommend anyone to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this does a nice job. Certainly not as premium of an experience as using an Apple Tv, but given the price difference I think it's more than acceptable. As some mentioned, it can feel a bit sluggish at times, but it still does a good job. Very easy to set up, you can skip the credit card details (just google Roku setup NOCC). I tested it on a crappy wifi (around 11-25Mb/s) and it connected and streamed in HD just fine. Got it as a present for a friend who just got a cheap LCD TV. I am sure she'll be delighted for the "smart" upgrade. :) P.S. Good set of wall plug adapters!
customer_reviews.author: Attila Vago

customer_reviews.title: The software is super quick and apps load and swap almost instantly
customer_reviews.text: I've been thinking about buying one of these for about a year. Honestly I cant believe I waited so long! The software is super quick and apps load and swap almost instantly. Having access to so many channels is really great. Its has access to every type of content and series, wether paid or 'free' with prime and Netflix. I will be downgrading my Virgin Media package to the basic one at the end of my contract. One last really neat and handy trick is mirror cast. I use my Surface Pro, phone and laptop on the TV by mirroring the screen through the Roku. Its a really clever trick and so easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Still works well for a wired internet connection
customer_reviews.text: Despite being a few years old still works well if you want to use a wired internet connection which the latest Roku's don't seem to offer. Software updated ok on installation (Aug 2020). Note that Roku no longer offer customer support on this model but it worked fine on set up which was straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Almost fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Would be fabulous if it worked. I can connect to everything except Netflix which resolutely refuses to connect to the netflix servers. Everything else connects and works fine... for a while. Then starts to get really unreliable. After 5 minutes or so it gets flaky and then locks up, requiring a restart. The firmware was up to date. Shame, would have been fabulous if it worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Family

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had and returned a firestick becuase you cant put age restrictions on amazon prime using a firestick (which is odd as you can on their tablets). This Roku was easy to set up and you can put age restrictions on. My daughter loves it. She is no longer trying to use the main TV which gives me half a chance and she can access it independantly as I know she cant get to anything she shouldnt watch. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stream Netflix on my tv. I plugged it in and initially found the interface a little clunky and quite ugly to be honest. I then had to try and update some software as it wouldn't work properly and kept shutting off and then when I finally got it working I plugged it in, it turned on, the ugly interface came up...and my tv broke. I've no doubt it was a coincidence and the ROKU streaming stick was not to blame - however I bought a new tv...with Netflix built in. I'm sure if I had it working I would have figured it out but unfortunately my experience of the RIKU stick wasn't a great one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr R Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast box. It also supports almost all UK streaming services (UKTV play being the one significant exception I know of). It's reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: A H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, with one shortcoming
customer_reviews.text: This is a great streaming player, but it does have one shortcoming. If you plug a disk drive into its USB port, it will play the media on the disk just fine, but the disk does not become visible on your network (unlike the WD TV Live, for instance). Therefore you cannot add new music files,etc, that you've downloaded from Amazon without unplugging the drive and plugging it into your main computer. So, I'd give it 5 stars as a streaming media player (i.e. for Amazon, Netflix, etc), and 3 stars as a local media player.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Thackery

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of kit. We are able to get all the apps for the services we subscribe to. NETFLIX, Amazon video, Now TV, iPlayer etc. Works great with all of the media we have in PLEX on a PC as well. It doesn't have a very fast processor so can feel a little slow in menus etc but that's a small price to pay for a beautifully simple and highly portable piece of kit. Supports HD no problem on all of our services.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use, and it has ALL the apps
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and it has ALL the main apps, unlike a very well know competitor which is missing a satellite-based program provider's app. Content is king - if you want all the catch-up apps for this country, this is the one. Works pretty well too, although there doesn't seem to be an 'off' setting. When you switch to Home its little white light stays on for about 15 minutes then goes off. I'm guessing it is then in standby mode.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: Great but.....
customer_reviews.text: Fab little device works like a dream! However a couple of niggles hence the 4 stars. Firstly you have to sign in with bank details which I hate with a passion! Secondly this does support amazon prime but be warned it's the American version not British, which somewhat limits your viewing ie breaking bad included in prime upto season 5 in the British version but only season 3 in America. Slightly frustrating as now I have to plug another device in to watch amazon prime. Which is what I was doing away with argh. Despite this is would still recommend
customer_reviews.author: cazbot

customer_reviews.title: Best media stick I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Apart from the annoying start up noise the stick makes I have been really impressed with it. It combines the best of all my TV services, filling the gaps that Amazon Firesticks and Chromecasts don't.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Complete rubbish - device got new firmware as part of install but crashed twice during its short period in use before we returned. Very difficult to set this up without using a credit card. Casting was also completely flakey. For the same money you can get a fire stick and Chromecast and have a much better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Cleanster

customer_reviews.title: Best TV Kit I've bought since the flat screen
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I did was buy this baby. Goodbye £77pm for Sky and Chromecast. Amazon Prime (£6.50pm) and Now TV Entertainment Pack (£4pm and yes I know it's Sky) so just under £10pm for more all you can view TV on demand with NO ADVERTS (not sure how long this will last)! Also supports Google Play, YouTube, Netflix, iPlayer, 5 on demand, ITV etc, etc. As an added bonus, it supports screen casting to any Windows 10 device like my Surface Pro 4!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good, and after 2 1/2 years, still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: After two a half years, it's still faithfully working. The USB power can come from your TV's USB plug with no problems. Very useful to stream Youtube videos from your cell phone, watch Netflix if you don't have it on your TV or another device, or tune in to hundreds of channels.
customer_reviews.author: A. T. Martins

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased we bought this. We were having issues with our free view box not recording when we were using it for Internet streaming. Using the roku instead has solved the issue. The set up is easy, and the navigation is very user friendly. I have knocked one star off as the supplied remote didn't work really. We eventually got through the set up with it sporadically working, and then chucked it in favour of the roku app on phone / iPad. Unfortunately you can't use the app until you have completed set up (for which you need the remote)
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Best thing to happen to my TV viewing
customer_reviews.text: I am a massive massive fan of the roku. I have had mine for about 3 years and bought two this Xmas for family. They are thrilled. This thing is on 24/7 in my house as the choice of content is amazing . Free movies. Free classic TV. Free cartoons. Free music videos. YouTube Plex now TV Amazon prime Netflicks Facebook.... The list just goes on and on. Absolutely awesome and will hopefully be able to upgrade to a newer player from roku soon as I've tried others and this company are on the top of their game
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stick to access Amazon Prime and Now TV on the same device. It does an OK job, but navigating menus is noticeably more sluggish than on my black Now TV box. So, whilst it's OK for multi-tasking, an appropriate Fire Stick or Now TV box may be better bets if you're only accessing one service. My Now TV box is quicker for iPlayer and the other free services, too. The Roku stick will run Netflix, too, and comes complete with a decent 5V power supply and lead. So probably no need to spend more.A complete package.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: So much to watch
customer_reviews.text: Replaced sky TV for her, nowtv is available on it and is pretty much the whole catchup library. Amazon, Netflix and youtube work well, plenty of streaming apps to choose from, simple to setup apart from the roku account which took a phone call but did work in the end. Would recommend, I can see why people quit paying for cable and satellite tv.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Best video stick so far
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant. This stick has a separate remote control unlike the Chromecast; it doesn't suffer some of the long-standing issues with Chromecast that I have with movies from a Plex server, and of course in one add-on I can do everything I want to see - across Amazon, Plex, Vevo, Netflix and Youtube. The dedicated buttons on the remote give swift access to the favourite services, and there are a ton of other applications and streaming services I haven't even begun to explore yet.
customer_reviews.author: niksgarage

customer_reviews.title: Expand your TV Capability
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward set up. Gives you access to all the 'Demand' versions of the terrestrial channels with plenty of weird and wonderful other channels if you want them. Wireless is fine and once set up you don't need to put the password in each time, which is useful. The remote control is easy to use, perhaps a bit laggy at times and features a button for 'RDIO' which no longer exists. It might have been an idea to make these shortcut buttons programmable. Still pleased with the product, especially for around £30.
customer_reviews.author: J Mark

customer_reviews.title: FREE Channels!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect.. Does actually what I wanted it to do... it gave my LG Smart TV a bit of an upgrade instead of buying a new TV... Netfllix, Amazon, BBC, ITV, C4, C5 Plus many more FREE channels, get them while they're cheap LOL Extremely easy to start and use.
customer_reviews.author: Badfilmlover

customer_reviews.title: Magic little box, that does everything!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace Now TV box and Fire stick. It is so simple to set up, plug & play! I use it for BBC iPlayer, ITV hub, All4, My5, Now TV and Amazon Prime. There are literally hundreds of other streaming channels available on it to, too many to list. Fantastic little box.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hovey

customer_reviews.title: ... present for Christmas to my uncle and he absolutely enjoyed it! So many features
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a present for Christmas to my uncle and he absolutely enjoyed it! So many features, compared to Google Chromecast for example (which I own). The setup of the device is a bit hectic (multiple steps, account creation over the internet) but once all is set, it's a pleasure to play with. I recommend to update the device as soon as possible as this would improve the wifi connectivity and add a few other features. There are tons of channels to add (news, weather, music, etc.) and every day you discover something new (1000+ channels). Would def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bogdan

customer_reviews.title: Great for streaming services, and its wired!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace Nowtv boxes which don’t allow amazon prime... Good item, and its wired so no WiFi issues. Only downside is the UI, searching is painfully slowly having to select 1 letter at a time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter. She has cable to her downstairs tv but it would have been expensive to have it in her bedroom upstairs as well. I suggested the Roku and gave it to her as an early Xmas present. She is delighted and the only downside is that she spends too much time in bed watching tv, particularly using catch-up to watch programmes that she missed. An excellent buy if you have good broadband.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mcgreal

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, and screen mirroring is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.text: Nice device, streams well enough and is pretty snappy speed-wise. The interface (at least in the apps I use most frequently - FilmOn and YouTube) can be fiddly, though that's a common issue with anything that doesn't have it's own (real or virtual) keyboard, but trying to type in search terms in YouTube for instance gets to be really tiring after a while - left a bit, select, up a bit, select, down and right a bit, select... keep going until you have all the letters of your search term. Screen mirrors nicely from my phone (Samsung A3), and during a test attempt from laptop it looked to be working well enough. Setup is a piece of cake. Overall, recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Philster

customer_reviews.title: Like it and got it very cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Been thinking about getting one of these for quite a while, but then got the opportunity to get one at a rock bottom "net price" after Amazon & Sony (not sure which!) screwed up access to some of the Amazon film purchase options for quite a long time and so I got a £40 credit to purchase a Fire Stick - but got the Roku instead for a net £15! Very pleased! :)
customer_reviews.author: John E. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great bit of kit.
customer_reviews.text: Bougth at an amaizng low prce thanks to Amazon.. Wanted the latest stick that has a remote and you can use with pratically all apps. Tuyrns a normal tv in to a smart TV. Set up is practically zero, and anyone can figure out how to use it. ONce you are logged into all of your accounts its good to go. The best thing is that you can take it with you on holiday, caravanning etc, and alsways something to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Gla98avb

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this Roku 2 for a few of days but it is solid in operation. Before buying this I had the Amazon Fire TV 4K which had no end of problems with crashes, out of sync catchup apps and jerky video. Despite very helpful product support It was eventually returned to Amazon. The Roku has not had any of these problems ... proving that it was not my setup that was the problem. The addition of Amazon Prime to the Roku 2 is a real bonus. Set up was easy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Riches

customer_reviews.title: Takes longer to decide what to watch now there is more choice! :) That's not a complaint!
customer_reviews.text: Opened up lots more films and tv shows / channels. Well impressed. It's very small as well, so not taking up a lot of room. One downside is that it remains on all the time, so if, like us, you've had to buy a HDMI switch to create an extra port, even though the switch (Betron HDMI 3 Port Switch) can automatically select by deciding which device is "on", you'll have to switch the switch manually... so get one with a remote.
customer_reviews.author: Clive E.

customer_reviews.title: Theoretically good, but freezes and poor support.
customer_reviews.text: This should have 5 stars. When it worked, it was great. It is compact, supported Now TV, Amazon, Google, Netflix etc etc - when it worked. But it freezes and refuses to work. Previously we could get it to work by resetting internet, taking out the batteries and switching the tv off. A quick Google confirms that it is a common problem. Unable to log on to Roku site and password reset doesnt work. Roku support were dire and made no attempt to resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: South Western

customer_reviews.title: OK, not great
customer_reviews.text: This requires a credit card when you register the thing, unless you search high and low across the internet for the "backdoor" sign in page. It didn't support Channel 4 live TV as far as I could tell. The remote control is touch and go, confusing user interface and sometimes it doesn't register presses. Anyway, I ended up donating it to a friend as a birthday present, and using a £10 Android stick which does everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. W. M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good, but no voice command/search.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but i don't understand why Roku felt that voice command should only be given to the US version of Roku 3? The fact that it can't be turned off is also a bit of a concern. It definitely gets a bit hot even when doing nothing, and i've occasionally had to unplug it when it started to feel sluggish. I would recommend to Roku that they either improve the cooling, hibernation feature or let the user manually put it into standby.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Price was good and it's fairly fast responding to handset commands
customer_reviews.text: Bought just for BBC iPlayer, ITV Hub etc (the free stuff). Price was good and it's fairly fast responding to handset commands. Bit of a faff registering at Roku though, had to register a credit card but a PIN helps prevent accidental use of pay TV. Works perfectly for what I need and wireless range is adequate for my house, TV is about 10m from router on the other side of a double brick wall.
customer_reviews.author: lucan

customer_reviews.title: Fab
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant! First one broke within a few weeks but Amazon replaced it and new ones had no problems. Great for watching now, Netflix, on demand channels, and more. Very easy to use and has a great search function.
customer_reviews.author: dfghjk

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: SUPER FAST delivery got it in two days even though it was close to new year day love the item it great for netflixs and youtube i wanted something to play films from a hard drive which this does however i needed to change some files from AVI to MP4 which is a big pain other than that the roku 2 is great
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Just falls short of being the perfect streamer
customer_reviews.text: been using this for a year now and works brilliantly streaming. There are a lot of channels available but most of these are for US users only and not UK which is disappointing so we don't get to see them. Mainly use for Netflix and Flixster along with streaming using Plex Media Server. Still mixed information from Amazon as they state you cannot use for Amazon Prime Video in the UK unless you have the 2015 model Pros Good Quality playback Small Cons Not all channels available for UK users Jan 2016: Amazon still state unless you have the 2015 model you can not watch Amazon Prime in the UK
customer_reviews.author: Walkerx

customer_reviews.title: Remote failure
customer_reviews.text: Remote worked intermittently for the first hour. Since I'd set up the Wi-Fi by then I've used the app for a year. Our Wi-Fi has changed providers and now we're completely locked out of the system. Regretting not letting Roku know they're giving out shoddy items now but I didn't want to take someone's present back the day after Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Julia Walker

customer_reviews.title: All in one device
customer_reviews.text: You can control via iPhone or Android phone..lot of applications..very easy to use..I don’t use any other devices..all in one device..small compact as well.. Quality very good..best thing during my lock down..if I didnot have this I would have bored to core..
customer_reviews.author: Jeethu J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, shame about the lack of Amazon Prime app
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 3 unit responds to commands quickly and feels like a solid unit. It is a real shame that Sky UK, who also use Roku units for Sky Now, have deliberately blocked the Amazon Prime application from being released on these units. It would have been 5 stars otherwise. Update Note:- If like me you experience a juddering of the picture there are two solutions 1) (if you have this option on your TV) turn "motion plus" off on your TV 2) set the Roku to 720P The second option of setting the Roku to 720P setting worked for me, it seems like these units are not set up for UK TV refresh rates when in 1080P.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. P. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great for catch-up TV and YouTube
customer_reviews.text: Bought primarily to provide access to catch-up TV services, it has also been useful to watch YouTube material on the main family TV. Its very small size makes it unobtrusive. We've made no use of it to access subscription-based services on TV or to play games to date. Its media player is limited and, though DLNA compliant, the device is unable to play any music from my iTunes libraries (AAC format) - for me this is the Roku's only significant failing. (I gather I could convert the many GB of music to a format that is supported, using software on my PC, if this was essential to my enjoyment.)
customer_reviews.author: Gardencoaster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little streaming stick
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant - easy to use, very good quality, and has everything you need. I bought it to solve the Now TV 'can't stream from your phone for no apparent reason' issue, and it's solved that perfectly. Not as slick or as flexible as an Amazon Fire TV box, but not as expensive either...and beats Apple TV into a cocked hat.
customer_reviews.author: David Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Stream, Netflix, Chill and more..
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to stream movies onto it. Especially chosen as it supports 1080p. Have not used the headphone functionality in the remote, but it's nice to have. Only downside is that it has no dedicated audio out to be able to wire up a surround sound receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Ashok

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, fast streaming but could have better wifi range.
customer_reviews.text: The stick is much faster and more reliable in connecting to the wifi than my older Roku box. The Roku box needs to stream SD whereas I can stream HD with the stick. I took off one star because the range could be improved. While my laptop, iPad and phone could all get excellent signal from the router from the same location I had to move my router closer to the TV for the Roku stick to find the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. James

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. Nice simple remote and an almost dazzling amount of content - a lot of which is free. If you have wifi and a tv with an HDMI slot, then a roku box is an essential item imo. Netflix, Now TV, Amazon Prime, iPlayer, YouTube and loads of others. Also the box itself it tiny, so it doesn't take up valuable shelf space.
customer_reviews.author: TwatSack

customer_reviews.title: Simple Streaming
customer_reviews.text: Delivery expectations were exceeded with the device arriving two days earlier than expected. Installation was straightforward and the device was up and running within half an hour. There was an initial freeze with the remote but this was quickly resolved using FAQs. The ability to link to a smartphone is useful and the app is intuitive to use. The stick is unobtrusive and provides excellent streaming capability with a wide choice of both free and fee channels. I would certainly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bolo1007

customer_reviews.title: Incredible 1080P streaming device for your HDTV
customer_reviews.text: Incredible 1080P streaming device for your HDTV. Allows you to add a lot of free content as well as Amazon Prime Video + Netflix. All you need is a HDMI cable & ideally CAT5 or 6 Ethernet Network cable as wired is way better than wireless for streaming media.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this, it's so small but works very well, loads of apps in the store, the only one I wish it had was Amazon instant but I guess that is Amazon trying to make you buy their box! Screen mirroring only currently works with a few devices as it is at beta stage but hopefully will get better with the update. But it does have a play to Ruku app which lets you stream music videos and pictures from any android. The normal Roku app lets you stream pictures music and video from any iOS device
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. J. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming if you're outside the UK
customer_reviews.text: When setting this up you have to give either your credit card or your paypal details to Roku - even if you've no intention of paying for any of the channels. The setup process determines your geographical location, and the channels made available to you depend on this. This means that if you're living outside the UK you can't install channels like iPlayer, 4OD etc. Apart from Netflix the channels left to choose from are really not worth wasting time on in my view. Of course you can get around this geo-restriction by paying for access to a smart DNS service. But if you're just looking for a Netflix and Plex interface I'm sure there are cheaper options than this.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and much better performance than the Roku 2!
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a Roku 2 streaming box, which did the job but had a lot of limitations.... (Particularly if when using the Roku 2 for Netflix)! The Roku 3 performs at a much higher level, you get full proper access to Netflix and it seems to function a lot faster and smoother than the Roku 2. I bought a previously used Roku 3 box, which saved a lot of money and it works absolutely fine. If you're going to be using it with Freeview as your only other viewing equipment as I do, it's definitely worth getting the better model. Just like the Roku 2, it's very easy to set up and user friendly. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Magpie

customer_reviews.title: Ok as a secondary unit
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant for anywhere in the house, I have it plugged into a Blaupunkt tv with USB port for my bedroom as a secondary tv, the only hiccup is the remote can be slow and if you put anything on pause you have to rewind a bit so it catches up with the image and the speech.
customer_reviews.author: Mandan Dm

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommended
customer_reviews.text: Best streaming box out there IMHO. All good apps without being tied into an Apple / Google / Sky / whatever ecosystem. We use the UK TV services, Netflix, Amazon Video and Plex services without any issues Easily worth the money and better performance that the "sticks".
customer_reviews.author: GRC

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and easy way to make an unsmart telly smart.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, followed the on-screen instructions (which included having to log on to Roku's web site) and it then worked perfectly. Really quite straightforward. For example, BBC iPlayer loaded up very quickly. I think the real advantage is that you plug it into the HDMI input on the TV. So my unsmart Samsung telly is now smart for just under 30 quid. Pretty good I'd say. Because the USB port on the back of my Samsung telly is close to the HDMI port, I also bought the EXINOZ Mini USB Cable for powering the Roku. This is well worth doing for the extra fiver.
customer_reviews.author: Sillaw

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of kit, once you are streaming, but the menus and load time are slow. I definitely wouldn't pay £40, but it was worth the £20 I paid. Love the remote control and the accompanying app!
customer_reviews.author: AaronK

customer_reviews.title: Requires credit card details off the bat for free apps
customer_reviews.text: Awful, the device will refuse to be set up unless you give them your credit card details. This was NOT explained and is misleading as other competitors such as the Amazon Fire Stick does not require this for use. I refuse to provide these details upfront and trust a company not to abuse it. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Daz

customer_reviews.title: Picture is good quality, doesn't seem to slow down the internet ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this more than we watch normal TV, mainly for Netflix, 4od and iPlayer. Picture is good quality, doesn't seem to slow down the internet whilst watching. Only problem is that the remote seems to only have a range of about 2-3 meters, if we try to use it from the far end of the sofa, it often doesn't work unless you lean forward a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best streaming device for UK use
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best streaming device for UK use - has all the catch-up channels, Plex, Amazon Prime, Netflix and Now TV. Always been able to stream at good quality, HD where available on a 10Mbs broadband connection. Highly recommended. The hundreds of other channels available are mostly complete junk, but there may be a couple of special interest that are for you - so don't buy it for the those!!
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: All my subscriptions in one place and much more
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this device. Lots of additional content and much better than buying a device for just one provider such ad NOW TV. Nice to have all my subscription services in one place. Zero problems with set up or usage so far. Try the yoga channel -very illuminating😁
customer_reviews.author: Paula Robinson-Aberdeen

customer_reviews.title: Roku support was helpful for networking issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make up for poor software on the TV that perhaps should have done the job itself. Simple to setup and use. I have BT Openreach and a BT Home Hub 4 plus a DNS based protection system. All channels we wanted worked: BBC IPlayer, Channel 4 OD, etc. except for Netflix which said it had networking issues. BT and Netflix were of no use but Roku support were very responsive and after a couple of e-mails Netflix was working too. Perhaps I should have given it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Roy E

customer_reviews.title: Great product for On-Demand - use with NowTV and save a fortune !
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 Roku's in our house as well as Virgin Media and I have to say I love them. they are much better for providing Netflix than Virgin, it being faster and easier to use. We also have NowTV (save yourself the Sky fee and get one of these + movies for @£10 a month), a home media server and now Amazon prime is available too. there are also many other channels depending on what your interest are. I'm even contemplating removing some of my Virgin Media services......
customer_reviews.author: GDW

customer_reviews.title: excellent picture quality not great for free content
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 3 HD streaming player does have some benefits, the main one being the picture quality. Some good paid for services eg Netflix (no Amazon prime but Netflix don't charge extra for certain content), now TV, wwe network but if you want to just use free services you will probably be disappointed. You can get iplayer, 4od, ITV player, 5od. If you use any sort of HDMI switch be aware this device is always on so could cause a problem. Some demonstration clips show this box as having an option to search for content but this isn't available.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect TV viewing
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little box. We can watch Netflix, Now TV and Prime as well as lots of other channels and apps. Easy to set up and great quality. It is a tiny little thing but packs a big punch. You can connect your phone to the box and use it as a remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Great unit unless you have Apple devices
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that 'currently the iOS devices are not supported for screen mirroring on Roku' (from Roku technical support who were slow and uninterested). So forget streaming to it from an iThing web browser unless you purchase a third party app and even then it's very iffy. Windows/Android devices apparently work. I will be returning mine and buying an alternative as its a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Good Product unless you want NowTV
customer_reviews.text: Linked the player direct to my router and all worked fine. Set up very straightforward. Hadn't worked so well using WI Fi though. All was going well until I attempted to set up a Now TV Account as I wanted to watch sky sports without a contract. Unable to create an account and constant error messages, no live chat, no phone number, indeed no one to assist at all. Gave up in the end and with regret therefore returned the box for a refund. Can't really fault the box, but sadly couldn't watch what I wanted thanks to the poor service of Now TV.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. James

customer_reviews.title: Watch the power requirements and load the new apps.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool by and large. Need to load new apps for 4 OD and ITV player as they are now '4All' and 'ITV Hub'. Dropped a star as I didn't like the fact I have to load credit card details either - might as well have got another Now TV box for a tenner... Dropped another star as it seems to have blown the PSU on my small telly - my fault maybe for not using the supplied power adapter and running power form the USB socket. If in doubt use teh supplied adapter is my suggestion..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: I have found the Roku stick much easier and simpler to operate than previous android TV devices that I have used in the past. It allows me to view Netflix, Amazon Prime and YouTube, which is all I need!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. E. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Slow to warm up, but ok
customer_reviews.text: It offers access to a number of apps, including Netflix, NowTV, and BBC iPlayer, however, is very slow to boot up compared to the NowTV stick (which does not offer Netflix). Ok if you want to turn a standard TV into a Smart-ish one.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Just Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this little device is amazing, much better than I expected. I have BT TV and an Amazon Prime subscription but couldn't watch prime or Now entertainment on my TV via my BT boxes but just plug this little unit in and power it via the on board USB port in the TV and I have everything in one place. It's so simple to set up and use. I'd very much recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Pat P

customer_reviews.title: Roku 3
customer_reviews.text: The latest video (and audio) streaming player from Roku offers full HD video over Wi-Fi. Similar to the Apple TV product; it allows you to stream content from your computer (you must have streaming software installed - many are free). I found it very easy to install and set up using Plex and iTunes on my Apple Mac and was able to watch video in minutes on my HD TV. The Roku 3 It has "channels" available via the internet, so with a good broadband/ADSL you can get paid and free content. While there are lots of channels, many are not worth looking at.
customer_reviews.author: Blue eye

customer_reviews.title: Great media player - Better than Apple TV and other similar items
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I own a lot of streaming players so have plenty of choose from including to name just a few; the Apple TV, Roku 3, iPad, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Laptop, Windows Media Center PC, Smart enabled TV... Dispite having so many possible devices to watch my content on, I still keep coming back to the Roku. It's less restrictive than the Apple TV, quicker and simpler to put something you want on than other devices. I'm in the UK so the top apps I use on my Roku are iPlayer, Netflix and 4OD. Great for all of these and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aran Reeks

customer_reviews.title: Limited use of different file formats to play.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this model for AVI/MP4/MKV ect. use. My 2017 Samsung TV will play anything you can throw at it which defeats the purpose of having this player at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Soap

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Amazing! Small, discrete and well made. Has wi-if and Ethernet connection but have found no need for cable. Video streams effortlessly from net flicks, from iMac and from Android phone. Plays large variety of video formats. In addition to the wireless remote ( you don't need to aim it at the tv!) there is a mobile app for streaming content to tv and backup remote control. Large selection of apps and games (spotify, YouTube, all UK channels 1,2,3,4,5, angry birds, Tetris, PAC man!) Plays content well off of usb stick too.
customer_reviews.author: Gav

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what the fuss is about!
customer_reviews.text: To be honest this is very poor. There was not much in the way of content and most of the stuff you had to pay for anyway. The amazon Fire box is a ton better!
customer_reviews.author: PC Gaming Fan

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, well packaged and seemed quite well made. But... Vast majority of the 'TV chanels' are little more than youtube clips that look homemade, and the rest is a huge range of the worst 'B' movies ever made. It wouldn't screen mirror my smartphone despite the info saying it should, and the 1080p setting wasn't noticably different to 720. Plugging your laptop into your tv does a better job so save your money. Mine went back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mr  B

customer_reviews.title: Great little gizmo
customer_reviews.text: Great little gizmo. Set up was really easy - just plugged it all in and that was it. You have to create a Roku account online and give credit card details but as I was only wanting this to access the free sites such as Netflix that wasn't a problem. Am now exploring many channels I never knew existed!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Beck

customer_reviews.title: Great (when you can get a decent WiFi signal!)
customer_reviews.text: When you can get a good WiFi signal this works really well - I use it to watch Amazon Prime etc... when I'm away from home and the hotel has a strong WiFi signal and a TV with a USB input. Frustrating when the WiFi signal is weak, as you would expect. Not the most intuitive setup, but pretty straightforward after the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Carr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very easy to set up and within 5min I had access to all the channels I needed. I like that it turns itself off when not in use for more than 5min. Very small and sleek design. Does what it says very very well.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: it does sort of but thankfully I wouldn't stop my Sky until I was satisfied It was working properly and that I could work ...
customer_reviews.text: We have tried and tried to get this to work. it does sort of but thankfully I wouldn't stop my Sky until I was satisfied It was working properly and that I could work it. My husband tried to set it all up on our other TV he has tried and tried, managed to get some on but not very much, there are no instructions you are expected to know how to work it, its very complicated. I would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Suevanna booth

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: I am not good with these sorts of technical things and always stretched for time - I managed to set this up on my own within 10 minutes. so simple providing you have fast wifi which I do. Now I can laze in my room watching netflix and bbc iplayer i don't need to leave. So Happy. I love the fact that Netflix has its own button too. Nothing bad to say about this proiduct at all!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: No Hitches
customer_reviews.text: Having had problems with Chromecast I decided to try Roku. Easy to set up and has worked with no hitches so far. Used three times thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Dee_EH13

customer_reviews.title: Is this beginning of the end for subscription satellite TV?
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little piece of kit. Bought specifically for Netflix but has all the TV catch up services in one place plus Google video, YouTube, radio and hundreds of other channels. Easy to use although it would be nice to be able to organise your own menus for the (many) channels you will end up choosing. Note that there is no subscription involved apart from (in my case) Netflix and you soon begin to wonder why you need subscription satellite TV at all.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Jackson

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - great product but you will be unable to use at ...
customer_reviews.text: WARNING - great product but you will be unable to use at all it unless you sign-up online for a Roku account which includes mandatory credit-card account details being provided. This is not explained in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works but slow response times with BBC iPlayer
customer_reviews.text: Get it fired-up a good 5 minutes before you want to watch. Irritating delays from pressing a button on the remote to the command being carried out on screen.
customer_reviews.author: Windum

customer_reviews.title: Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased roku because my chromecast is not supporting miracast and I want to mirror my laptop to tv via streaming stick. I does work with roku but lag is terrible, it is basically useless for that purpose. I can't cast directly from apps like YouTube or iplayer from my smartphone. You can use roku app but it is not convenient. When you use remote control is ok, but still very slow. I am disappointed with it. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Radek

customer_reviews.title: Great but you will need to buy a HDMI and Ethernet cable separately.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars but it doesn't come with the basic cables to get it working. You will need a HDMI and ethernet cable. Otherwise it is a nice responsive streamer which isn't locked into content from only one provider.
customer_reviews.author: James Bewley

customer_reviews.title: Poor Apps if you need subtitles
customer_reviews.text: The device works really well, supporting Netflix, Amazon, iplayer etc. But these are the only apps that work well. The catchup channels ITV, channel 4 and channel 5 are really poor. They do not support subtitles although the PC app does, so I have to connect PC to TV to watch. Too many ads and don't bother if you need subtitles.
customer_reviews.author: Mr H.
